ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Dhamkuria Rural & Urban Development Organisation is a non-profit, non-political, non-religious, non-government seeking social welfare organisation started its journey towards the cause of multipurpose social welfare in trhe year 1980 and formally got it registered under the West Bengal Societies Registration Act XXVI of 1961 in the year 1983-1984 & registered under foregin contribution regulation act 1976 in the year 1999. Since establishment the organisation is tirelessly working for advancement and well being of rural down trodden people of its target area particularily for proverty elevation. Primary and adult education, self employment generation, vocational training and many other is in the field of women and child welfare for upliftment of women and children. youth in rural weaker section particularly those belongs to SC / STs. The organisation has formed sectional youth commities, women committee, village development committee and is exprience in literacy development through non-formal education, early childhood education in association with Govt. and non-govt organisation to reach its targeted grass root destination.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Through a series of Skill Development Programs, the Dhulagori Mahila Samity (DMS) has so far successfully trained more than 300 women in Mushroom Cultivation, Batik and Fabric Painting, Smokeless Chullah manufacturing, Coloured Fish Cultivation etc., apart from some of the current programs raining them in other spheres as well. Many success stories have made the Samity proud. Skill Development Training Courses are also made available for women who come from single earning backgrounds or have been abandoned by their husbands and families. Multinational Corporate, PepsiCo India, has been funding two such programs in Soft Toy Making and Cutting & Tailoring, which have seen immense success. The MNC has also helped put up several stalls at several local fairs in and around Howrah District which displayed and sold the products made by the beneficiaries and have acquired accolades from visiting Ministers and other dignitaries. So far more than 200 women have successfully completed these courses. This year, PepsiCo had funded two other such training programs â€“ Beautician Training and Cutting and Tailoring. Under its Health Programs Dhulagori Mahila Samity has so far successfully conducted innumerable HIV/AIDS Awareness Camps in and around Howrah; Blood Donation Camps; Women Awareness Camps most of which focused on Mother and Child issues etc. At present, the Samity is collaborating with CBCI CARD under its Global Fund Round 9 Project to support & strengthen national RNTCP (DOTS) Program with the view to eradicate the dreaded Tuberculosis disease from the nation. Dhulagori Mahila Samity is also running a NCLP (National Child Labour Project) School for working children at its premises in Dhulagori funded by the Government of India. Presently there are about 50 children who are being benefited under this scheme aged between five to fourteen years. Under the NCLP Scheme these children are being given a basic education and mid day meals in order to be able to get them back in the mainstream academics. As Dhulagori Mahila Samity is situated in the heart of Howrahâ€™s fast developing new industrial belt, there is a large truck and bus terminus in the vicinity of the Organizationâ€™s premises. This is where the Samity has so far conducted more than 50 Health Awareness Camps with the view to promoting HIV/AIDS Awareness amongst one of the most vulnerable sections of society, the truck and bus drivers who travel far and wide for several weeks at a time throughout the country. Under its other Health Programs DMS has also successfully conducted immunization camps, blood donation camps as well as several Awareness Camps amongst women of the area related to Mother and Child as well as diseases pertaining to women.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: DIAMOND SILK KHADI SOCIETY, having its address at vill. & P.o- Sujapur in the district of Malda, W.B. was established in the year 1980-81 by getting registered with the Registrar of Firms Societies & Non Trading corporation, West Bengal, Regd. No. S/31201 of 1980-81 and subsequently got certified by Khadi & V.I. Commission, Mumbai vide its certificate No. S/3566. The society has 9 members in its executive committee with the secretary as its administrative head. The Institution presently has been working in 4 districts like Malda, Murshidabad, Birbhum and also South Dinajpur with about 450 Nos. rural artisans and engaged in the production and sale of Silk & Muslin khadi selling out in and around many states of India, mostly at the state of Kerala, Rajasthan. It has been certified by ISO 9001:2008 and got National Award in the year 2008 and 2014 for its performance. The society obtained Bank Finance and smoothly working in remote village with the poor rural artisans. It is famous for its splendid activities and by degrees expanding its activities. The artisans working under its fold are satisfied with wages for timely payments together with Bonus and Kolyan Kosh. For this year KVIC has fixed up target Rs. 5.00 Crore production under Silk & Muslin khadi Production.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We introduce ourselves as a leading theatre group, named in the memory of great stage and film actor Late Durgadas Bandyopadhyay for the last 65 years in the field of drama, art and culture. Since its inception in 1945, apart from other social activities, our organisation is active in preserving and propagating the cultural heritage specially in the field of drama. This is a registered organization under the West Bengal Societies Registration Act and also affiliated to West Bengal State Drama Academy. Till the end of 2009, the organization has produced as many as 50 full length and approximately 40 short plays. In addition, it has also been engaged in arousing consciousness in the minds of children through free of cost Drama and Recitation classes. In 1972, the troupe had observed Silver Jubilee year. On this occasion the organisation staged the famous drama FERARI FOUZ written by Utpal Dutta. Many eminent personalities such as Debnarayan Gupta, Manmatha Roy and others were present to grace the occasion. In 1985 the new building of the institution was inaugurated in presence of Smt. Saraju Devi, who was incidentally the co-actress of Durgadas Bandyopadhyay in many films and dramas. The same year, the troupe produced BISARJAN by Rabindra Nath Tagore which was praised by many of the eminent theatre personalities of the state. 1992, the birth centenary of Durgadas Bandyopadhyay, was a special year to the comrades of the troupe which we observed through a-year-long programme. Apart from organizing theatre festival the troupe also conducted different theatre education programmes including seminars / interactive discussion sessions on different aspects of art and culture. This year the organization produced SOROSHI â€” a play written by Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay. In 1995 â€” the Golden Jubilee year of the organization, the troupe had organized a theatre festival with other allied theatrical activities like organizing seminars, and exhibition of the photographs of several remarkable theatre production of Bengal. The organization had observed centenary of Bretoldt Brechect in 2000 â€” produced BATIKRAM, a play based on the original drama THE EXCEPTION OF THE RULE by Bretoldt Brechect. In order to propagate and preserve the memory of this famous actor, since 2000 we are regularly holding DURGADAS NATYOTSAB. We declare every year DURGADAS SANMAN, an award felicitated to an eminent theatre personality considering the lifetime contribution and achievement in the said field and some of the eminent personalities in this list were Sri Bibhas Chakraborty, Smt. Gita De, Smt.Maya Ghosh, Smt. Preeti Chatterjee, Sri Soumitra Chattopadhyay. We also organise every year Durgadas Memorial Lecture delivered by the famous Theatre Personality. Currently the troupe has three full-length productions namely AASARER EK DIN by Mohan Rakesh, CHIRAKUMAR SABHA by Rabindra Nath Tagore and AMLA-MADHUR by Harimadhav Mukhopadhyay all directed by Tirthankar Chattopadhyay and two short plays namely MANANSAI and KHELAGHAR written by Ramaprasad Banik and directed by Tirthankar Chattioadhyay in its repertoire.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Achievement: This strong association between the functionaries of ERDS and the local youth club members was based on a common zeal and understanding to improve the quality of life in the villages. This association clicked so effectively every where that the local youth became the â€˜Torch â€“ bearerâ€™ for the functionaries. In fact, most of the difficulties faced by the functionariesâ€™ at the initial stages were sorted out with the help of local youth club members only. The most effective and meaningful role in involving the community in the process of bringing about improved quality of life was played by none other than the children of the project areas. ERDS, undoubtedly, has been able to attract the attention of all types of community leaders â€“ the Panchayet members, traditional caste/community leaders, religious leaders, political leaders, school teachers, women groups, youth club etc. to the sponsorship program and its benefits. â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦As a sequel to the efforts made by one and all as stated above, there now exits a sense of togetherness among the villagers, their readiness to change and their conscious efforts to take up collective action on such issues which affect their lives. This has been the most crucial achievement of the sponsorship program as well as ERDS. There is no doubt that this is the beginning of the community empowerment process and the beginning has been well initiated. The rest is naturally assured. For ERDS, the concept of community participation is never a â€˜borrowedâ€™ or â€˜imposedâ€™ concept; rather it is ingrained in the organizational building process. The Chief Functionary who has established and nurtured ERDS as an organization for â€˜working with the peopleâ€™ has, because of his praise â€“ worthy personal characteristics and tremendous leadership skills, emerged as a role model for voluntary workers. The forms and strategies of communication adopted by the functionaries in communicating with the people have proved to be very effective and meaningful in motivating the people. Judicious use of folk media such as plays, puppet-shows etc. has attractive the attention of the people in a very encouraging way. In addition, the personality traits showed by the functionaries such as simplicity, cordiality, personal touch, displaying respect and dignity to the people, taking people into confidence, listening to their problems etc. have played a crucial role in facilitating community participation. The mechanism for supervision as followed by ERDS disserves all praise as it is absolutely based on mutual trust and respect â€“ not the one which is normally found in an organizational set up. ERDS Activities: Campaign Against Child Trafficking, Child Sponsorship Programme, Read To Lead Programme, Sanitary Mart, Sponsor a Grand parent Project, Jhilmil School, Educate A Child Programme, Creche & State Govt. Balwadi Centre, Specific Need Programme, Skill Development Training, Mainstreaming Street & Working Children, Publishing Alor Janya Patrika and Provide live stocks to poor families to boost up their meager income.
